channel.title: How do I find out what my "Path" and "Classpath" should be?
channel.description: I have JDK V6 Update 16. Is there somewhere that tells me what my "Path" and "classpath" (on environmental variables) should be?

item.title: How do I find out what my "Path" and "Classpath" should be?
item.dc:creator: @corney34 corney34
item.description:
@corney34 wrote:

Here:

Step1. go to my computer and click “view system information”
step2. click the “advanced” tab
Step3. Click on Enviroment Variables.
Step4. create a new variable on system variables.
step5. name it: CLASSPATH now use this as variable: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin
step6. make another new one, call it PATH use this variable: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin
step7. click ok and it will auto-apply then click ‘x’ and you’re done

Hope i helped!

Read full topic
item.source: How do I find out what my "Path" and "Classpath" should be?

item.title: How do I find out what my "Path" and "Classpath" should be?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

No… its in System Properties. Goto Control Panel, system properties, then goto advanced tab. Click on environmental variables. Thats where you set them.

Read full topic
